ed0n6hz.Author: AdvertiseGiftEconomy
ed0n6hz.Text:
This is very important for everyone to raise awareness about. It is no coincidence that projects such as BITCOIN and others, that are a threat to the establishment are being divided again and again. It's PSYOP/sabotage tactics and there are more than just "divide and conquer".[https://theintercept.imgix.net/wp-uploads/sites/1/2014/02/deception\_p48.png?auto=compress,format&q=90](https://theintercept.imgix.net/wp-uploads/sites/1/2014/02/deception_p48.png?auto=compress%2Cformat&q=90)

We will overcome the PSYOP/sabotage by raising awareness about it, learning and teaching their tactics to make sure to avoid falling for them and keep each other in check to not do them either.This is a great starting point to know some of their general tactics:

[http://www.openculture.com/2015/12/simple-sabotage-field-manual.html](http://www.openculture.com/2015/12/simple-sabotage-field-manual.html)

Then this article of info revealed by Edward Snowden:

[https://theintercept.com/2014/02/24/jtrig-manipulation/](https://theintercept.com/2014/02/24/jtrig-manipulation/)

Here is a documentary of these tactics being used by the Israel lobby on the BDS movement:

[https://youtu.be/rVOyTChStlY](https://youtu.be/rVOyTChStlY)

Here is a summary of counter sabotage tactics from a PSYOP manual: [https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1oRbAVNMHTUQ\_UYfErmtO5783xA4hgXXo?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1oRbAVNMHTUQ_UYfErmtO5783xA4hgXXo?usp=sharing)

Here is a folder with full manuals in it:[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tXLrKIW0Exem3hdYiqoamoYl3jxmflJH/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tXLrKIW0Exem3hdYiqoamoYl3jxmflJH/view?usp=sharing)

We are a legion. We are gaining ground.

ecx1b7q.Author: [deleted]
ecx1b7q.Text:
DO NOT SEND THIS FILE TO ANY ASSHOLES WHO PM YOU THEY WILL HELP

1. Make a couple backups
2. Don't brag about this to friends
1. Download the core client as others have said
2. Wait for it to sync (this will take days)
3. Replace the wallet.dat file with your BTCwallet.dat file (located in \Users\YourUserName\Appdata\Roaming\Bitcoin\wallet.dat if you are on a PC). Rename it to wallet.dat
4. Restart the core program
5. See whats up

ecxekg1.Author: iwearahoodie

ecw07vj.Author: cryptogrip
ecw07vj.Text: There is absolutely positively without any doubt NO way to know where the price will go. If you believe in a future where more people own bitcoin and potentially use it as a currency, store of value etc., then it makes no difference if you bought at 3500 or 4k. Personally, after the rollercoaster ride of the past few years, none of the current price movement makes a lot of difference unless you're trading daily. Anything under 6k is a good entry point if you're looking long term.

ecwy4g5.Author: AussieBitcoiner
ecwy4g5.Text:
To access bitcoins in a dat file you can download the bitcoin client Bitcoin Core from here: https://bitcoin.org/en/download

You have to download the entire block chain (over 200 GB) and your computer has to verify each block, the whole process can take a while. 

Once up and running, exit it, find and replace its wallet file with yours, then re-start. you may have to enter a password if your wallet file was encrypted with one.

I would recommend you make another copy of your BTCwallet file and put it on something else first, so if the shit hits the fan you still have a good copy

If you want to learn about what bitcoin is while you wait, a good list of resources can be found here: https://lopp.net/bitcoin.html

ecx1kic.Author: BitcoinMD

ecwz6px.Author: AussieBitcoiner
ecwz6px.Text:
>Should I put a copy of the file from the thumb drive on every device I own?

probably don't need to go that far. as long as you have 2 safe copies you should be ok. I wouldn't expect the file to be corrupt if the drive hasn't been wiped or re-formatted since. even then there should be a good chance it is fine. copy/paste to other locations shouldn't corrupt it either, just keep the original copy in case.

ecwzq2p.Author: Hellwiss
ecwzq2p.Text:
Yeah, make some more backups... Making backups does not hurt file (if it is not broken already). 

Also, downloading whole blockchain can take a while, to save some time, you can also download bootstrap - blockchain downloaded by somebody alse, you will just verify it...

first link I found... 
https://coinguides.org/bitcoin-bootstrap-dat-source-usage/

But don't put there your wallet file until everything is done and verified.
